info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CENTRE...WEST CENTRAL UNION AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bellefonte, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Carroll, Woodward, Lamar, Millheim, Aaronsburg, Rebersburg, Madisonburg, Mackeyville, R.B. Winter State Park, Loganton and McCall Dam State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania.
